20101226030007.000|20101226030008.000|TR0|ANDERSON COOPER, HOST:  In the darkest of 
20101226030008.000|20101226030010.000|TR0|places, in the darkest of moments, they 
20101226030010.000|20101226030012.000|TR0|became each other's heroes.  A half mile 
20101226030012.000|20101226030014.000|TR0|beneath the earth's surface, they endured. 
20101226030014.000|20101226030015.000|TR0| Supporting each other, never losing 
20101226030015.000|20101226030017.000|TR0|faith, they worked together to survive for 
20101226030017.000|20101226030019.000|TR0|their families and friends waiting above.

20101226030021.000|20101226030023.000|TR0|They never let each other stop believing 
20101226030023.000|20101226030024.000|TR0|the day would come when they would be 
20101226030024.000|20101226030026.000|TR0|lifted up one by one, back into the world 
20101226030026.000|20101226030028.000|TR0|they loved.
20101226030028.000|20101226030030.000|TR0|
20101226030030.000|20101226030032.000|TR0|For 69 days, we were amazed by these 33 
20101226030032.000|20101226030033.000|TR0|brave miners.  Their ordeal was 
20101226030033.000|20101226030035.000|TR0|unthinkable.  Their rescue unbelievable.  
20101226030035.000|20101226030037.000|TR0|No one has ever been trapped underground 
20101226030037.000|20101226030039.000|TR0|so deep for so long and survived.
20101226030039.000|20101226030040.000|TR0|
20101226030040.000|20101226030042.000|TR0|They endured a nightmare.  They experience 
20101226030042.000|20101226030044.000|TR0|add miracle.  And in the end, they became

20101226030445.000|20101226030447.000|TR0|COOPER:  We begin with a hero whose 
20101226030447.000|20101226030449.000|TR0|mission is to feed starving kids around 
20101226030449.000|20101226030451.000|TR0|the world, concentrating most recently on 
20101226030451.000|20101226030452.000|TR0|Haiti.  It's a country obviously that's 
20101226030452.000|20101226030454.000|TR0|still in dire need of our help.
20101226030454.000|20101226030456.000|TR0|
20101226030456.000|20101226030458.000|TR0|Here to tell this hero's story is a proud 
20101226030458.000|20101226030500.000|TR0|supporter of Artist for Peace and Justice, 
20101226030500.000|20101226030501.000|TR0|Gerard Butler.

20101226030507.000|20101226030509.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226030509.000|20101226030510.000|TR0|
20101226030510.000|20101226030512.000|TR0|BUTLER:  Whenever a story starts like this 
20101226030512.000|20101226030514.000|TR0|-- two brothers walk into a bar -- it 
20101226030514.000|20101226030516.000|TR0|usually doesn't end well.  But this 
20101226030516.000|20101226030517.000|TR0|story's different.
20101226030517.000|20101226030519.000|TR0|
20101226030519.000|20101226030521.000|TR0|Magnus MacFarlane-Barrow walked into a bar 
20101226030521.000|20101226030523.000|TR0|with his brother.  While having a drink, 
20101226030523.000|20101226030525.000|TR0|they talked about the heart-wrenching 
20101226030525.000|20101226030526.000|TR0|images from the Bosnian War they just seen 
20101226030526.000|20101226030528.000|TR0|on TV.
20101226030528.000|20101226030530.000|TR0|
20101226030530.000|20101226030532.000|TR0|And so, they made an extraordinary 
20101226030532.000|20101226030534.000|TR0|decision most of us don't make -- they 
20101226030534.000|20101226030535.000|TR0|decided to help.  And drove a truck filled 
20101226030535.000|20101226030537.000|TR0|with supplies to Bosnia.  Twenty-three 
20101226030537.000|20101226030539.000|TR0|times, Magnus drove from Scotland to 
20101226030539.000|20101226030541.000|TR0|Bosnia. That amazing act of kindness led 
20101226030541.000|20101226030543.000|TR0|to his life's work.
20101226030543.000|20101226030544.000|TR0|
20101226030544.000|20101226030546.000|TR0|He started Mary's Meals and feeds more 
20101226030546.000|20101226030548.000|TR0|than 420,000 children a day in 15 
20101226030548.000|20101226030550.000|TR0|countries.  Every day, he lets children 
20101226030550.000|20101226030551.000|TR0|know that they matter. That someone 
20101226030551.000|20101226030553.000|TR0|thousands of miles away cares about them.  
20101226030553.000|20101226030555.000|TR0|One simple decision and millions of 
20101226030555.000|20101226030557.000|TR0|starving children have been fed.
20101226030557.000|20101226030559.000|TR0|
20101226030559.000|20101226030600.000|TR0|That's what Magnus did.  And it's the 
20101226030600.000|20101226030602.000|TR0|story of a hero --
20101226030602.000|20101226030604.000|TR0|
20101226030604.000|20101226030606.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226030606.000|20101226030608.000|TR0|
20101226030608.000|20101226030609.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101226030609.000|20101226030611.000|TR0|
20101226030611.000|20101226030613.000|TR0|MAGNUS MCFARLANE-BARROW, CNN HERO:  I 
20101226030613.000|20101226030615.000|TR0|think of my upbringing as, in some ways, 
20101226030615.000|20101226030616.000|TR0|being quite privileged growing up in this 
20101226030616.000|20101226030618.000|TR0|beautiful part of the world, such a 
20101226030618.000|20101226030620.000|TR0|peaceful place. But in 1992, during the 
20101226030620.000|20101226030622.000|TR0|height of the war in Bosnia, I watched 
20101226030622.000|20101226030624.000|TR0|this news report talking about how people 
20101226030624.000|20101226030625.000|TR0|were suffering.  I was really amazed when 
20101226030625.000|20101226030627.000|TR0|I realized that I could do something to 
20101226030627.000|20101226030629.000|TR0|help them.  And since then, it's been one 
20101226030629.000|20101226030631.000|TR0|step at a time.
20101226030631.000|20101226030633.000|TR0|
20101226030633.000|20101226030634.000|TR0|And today, we're feeding about 420,000 
20101226030634.000|20101226030636.000|TR0|children every day in 15 different 
20101226030636.000|20101226030638.000|TR0|countries.  It's just lots of us doing 
20101226030638.000|20101226030640.000|TR0|little things, people who donate money or 
20101226030640.000|20101226030641.000|TR0|who volunteer their time, lots of small 
20101226030641.000|20101226030643.000|TR0|acts of love.
20101226030643.000|20101226030645.000|TR0|
20101226030645.000|20101226030647.000|TR0|I thought I'd seen it all in Africa and 
20101226030647.000|20101226030649.000|TR0|different parts of the world. But I was 
20101226030649.000|20101226030650.000|TR0|really shocked but what I saw in Haiti.
20101226030650.000|20101226030652.000|TR0|
20101226030652.000|20101226030654.000|TR0|The squalor here is just unbelievable.  
20101226030654.000|20101226030656.000|TR0|Three hundred thousand people living on 
20101226030656.000|20101226030658.000|TR0|what was a rubbish dump.
20101226030658.000|20101226030659.000|TR0|
20101226030659.000|20101226030701.000|TR0|It's poverty that strips people of their 
20101226030701.000|20101226030703.000|TR0|dignity.
20101226030703.000|20101226030705.000|TR0|
20101226030705.000|20101226030707.000|TR0|I feel a real sadness for the children, to 
20101226030707.000|20101226030708.000|TR0|see them living amongst this.  It makes me 
20101226030708.000|20101226030710.000|TR0|feel very, very sad.
20101226030710.000|20101226030712.000|TR0|
20101226030712.000|20101226030714.000|TR0|What's your name?
20101226030714.000|20101226030715.000|TR0|
20101226030715.000|20101226030717.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED BOY:  Peter Ambola (ph).
20101226030717.000|20101226030719.000|TR0|
20101226030719.000|20101226030721.000|TR0|MCFARLANE-BARROW:  Peter Ambola.  My name 
20101226030721.000|20101226030723.000|TR0|is Magnus.
20101226030723.000|20101226030724.000|TR0|
20101226030724.000|20101226030726.000|TR0|When you come back here to our world of 
20101226030726.000|20101226030728.000|TR0|plenty and privilege, I feel distraught 
20101226030728.000|20101226030730.000|TR0|that children are living like that.  And 
20101226030730.000|20101226030732.000|TR0|I'm talking about before the earthquake.  
20101226030732.000|20101226030733.000|TR0|Since the earthquake, there are all kinds 
20101226030733.000|20101226030735.000|TR0|of other horrors here also.
20101226030735.000|20101226030737.000|TR0|
20101226030737.000|20101226030739.000|TR0|We wanted to do something.  And we began 
20101226030739.000|20101226030740.000|TR0|providing meals for children in Cite 
20101226030740.000|20101226030742.000|TR0|Soleil and in these schools that have been 
20101226030742.000|20101226030744.000|TR0|built there by Father Tom, an American 
20101226030744.000|20101226030746.000|TR0|priest.
20101226030746.000|20101226030748.000|TR0|
20101226030748.000|20101226030749.000|TR0|FATHER TOM HAGAN, FOUNDER, HANDS TOGETHER: 
20101226030749.000|20101226030751.000|TR0| After the earthquake, a lot of the 
20101226030751.000|20101226030753.000|TR0|children lost their parents.  So, they 
20101226030753.000|20101226030755.000|TR0|were just wandering the streets.  You 
20101226030755.000|20101226030757.000|TR0|know, all we had to say was we have 50,000 
20101226030757.000|20101226030758.000|TR0|kids that need food.  He got it for us.  
20101226030758.000|20101226030800.000|TR0|It's just been a Godsend for us.
20101226030800.000|20101226030802.000|TR0|
20101226030802.000|20101226030804.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  We put in pepper, 
20101226030804.000|20101226030805.000|TR0|for flavor.
20101226030805.000|20101226030807.000|TR0|
20101226030807.000|20101226030809.000|TR0|MACFARLANE-BARROW:  When you see hungry 
20101226030809.000|20101226030811.000|TR0|children, the first thing you want to do 
20101226030811.000|20101226030813.000|TR0|is get them something to eat.  But you 
20101226030813.000|20101226030814.000|TR0|also want to set them free and that's why 
20101226030814.000|20101226030816.000|TR0|we provide those meals in school.  Allow 
20101226030816.000|20101226030818.000|TR0|them to benefit from the education which 
20101226030818.000|20101226030820.000|TR0|can be their way out of poverty.
20101226030820.000|20101226030822.000|TR0|
20101226030822.000|20101226030823.000|TR0|You can see that change is possible.  It's 
20101226030823.000|20101226030825.000|TR0|a wonderful thing to see.
20101226030825.000|20101226030827.000|TR0|
20101226030827.000|20101226030829.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)
20101226030829.000|20101226030831.000|TR0|

20101226030832.000|20101226030834.000|TR0|
20101226030834.000|20101226030836.000|TR0|BUTLER:  Please join me in honoring CNN

20101226030841.000|20101226030843.000|TR0|

20101226030847.000|20101226030848.000|TR0|it's also wonderful.  It's wonderful to be 
20101226030848.000|20101226030850.000|TR0|able to receive this award on behalf of

20101226030854.000|20101226030856.000|TR0|that we have: that every child in the 
20101226030856.000|20101226030857.000|TR0|world should be able to receive at least 
20101226030857.000|20101226030859.000|TR0|one good meal every day in a place of 
20101226030859.000|20101226030901.000|TR0|education.
20101226030901.000|20101226030903.000|TR0|

20101226030947.000|20101226030949.000|TR0|COOPER:  Welcome back.  When CNN asked 
20101226030949.000|20101226030951.000|TR0|viewers to help us find heroes around the 
20101226030951.000|20101226030953.000|TR0|world, we received over 10,000 nominations 
20101226030953.000|20101226030955.000|TR0|from over 100 countries.
20101226030955.000|20101226030956.000|TR0|
20101226030956.000|20101226030958.000|TR0|This next honorary lost her freedom, her 
20101226030958.000|20101226031000.000|TR0|child and nearly lost her life.  But she 
20101226031000.000|20101226031002.000|TR0|transformed her pain into salvation for 
20101226031002.000|20101226031003.000|TR0|other women and transformed herself into a 
20101226031003.000|20101226031005.000|TR0|hero.  Here to sing her praises is a proud 
20101226031005.000|20101226031007.000|TR0|fighter for V-Day, helping to end violence 
20101226031007.000|20101226031009.000|TR0|toward women, Marisa Tomei.
20101226031009.000|20101226031011.000|TR0|
20101226031011.000|20101226031012.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226031012.000|20101226031014.000|TR0|
20101226031014.000|20101226031016.000|TR0|TOMEI:  We all have someone in our life 
20101226031016.000|20101226031018.000|TR0|who causes us a lot of heartache.  We fear 
20101226031018.000|20101226031020.000|TR0|that they will never change.  And we 
20101226031020.000|20101226031021.000|TR0|quietly wonder if it's time to give up on 
20101226031021.000|20101226031023.000|TR0|them.
20101226031023.000|20101226031025.000|TR0|
20101226031025.000|20101226031027.000|TR0|The story of our next hero makes me want 
20101226031027.000|20101226031028.000|TR0|to answer that with one word: never.
20101226031028.000|20101226031030.000|TR0|
20101226031030.000|20101226031032.000|TR0|Susan Burton was at home when grief 
20101226031032.000|20101226031034.000|TR0|knocked on her door.  Her young son was 
20101226031034.000|20101226031036.000|TR0|struck by a car and killed.  The loss 
20101226031036.000|20101226031037.000|TR0|shattered her world. She struggled with 
20101226031037.000|20101226031039.000|TR0|addiction.  And for more than a decade, 
20101226031039.000|20101226031041.000|TR0|she moved in and out of jail.
20101226031041.000|20101226031043.000|TR0|
20101226031043.000|20101226031045.000|TR0|Then her life turned.  She got clean.  She 
20101226031045.000|20101226031046.000|TR0|found a job.  She bought a house -- a 
20101226031046.000|20101226031048.000|TR0|house not just for her but for other women 
20101226031048.000|20101226031050.000|TR0|struggling just like she was.  It's called 
20101226031050.000|20101226031052.000|TR0|a New Way of Life Reentry Project.
20101226031052.000|20101226031053.000|TR0|
20101226031053.000|20101226031055.000|TR0|And there are now five houses in Los 
20101226031055.000|20101226031057.000|TR0|Angeles where she's helped hundreds of 
20101226031057.000|20101226031059.000|TR0|women set things right.  So many have a 
20101226031059.000|20101226031101.000|TR0|chance --
20101226031101.000|20101226031102.000|TR0|
20101226031102.000|20101226031104.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226031104.000|20101226031106.000|TR0|
20101226031106.000|20101226031108.000|TR0|TOMEI:  -- so many have a chance because 
20101226031108.000|20101226031110.000|TR0|she didn't give up on them. And neither 
20101226031110.000|20101226031111.000|TR0|should we.
20101226031111.000|20101226031113.000|TR0|
20101226031113.000|20101226031115.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101226031115.000|20101226031117.000|TR0|
20101226031117.000|20101226031119.000|TR0|SUSAN BURTON, CNN HERO:  I remember the 
20101226031119.000|20101226031120.000|TR0|last time being released from prison.  I 
20101226031120.000|20101226031122.000|TR0|was so elated to be walking out of the 
20101226031122.000|20101226031124.000|TR0|door, so excited. And the guard told me, 
20101226031124.000|20101226031126.000|TR0|"I'll see you back in a little while."
20101226031126.000|20101226031127.000|TR0|
20101226031127.000|20101226031129.000|TR0|When you're released from prison, you're 
20101226031129.000|20101226031131.000|TR0|released with $200 and adios. And many 
20101226031131.000|20101226031133.000|TR0|people don't even make it past that 
20101226031133.000|20101226031135.000|TR0|downtown Skid Row bus station.  I thought, 
20101226031135.000|20101226031136.000|TR0|I know what I could do.  And I began to 
20101226031136.000|20101226031138.000|TR0|help women come home from prison.
20101226031138.000|20101226031140.000|TR0|
20101226031140.000|20101226031142.000|TR0|I bought a house.  I put bunk beds up.  
20101226031142.000|20101226031144.000|TR0|And I began to invite women into the house.
20101226031144.000|20101226031145.000|TR0|
20101226031145.000|20101226031147.000|TR0|We supported each other in recovery.  And 
20101226031147.000|20101226031149.000|TR0|a way of life was born.
20101226031149.000|20101226031151.000|TR0|
20101226031151.000|20101226031152.000|TR0|(MUSIC)
20101226031152.000|20101226031154.000|TR0|
20101226031154.000|20101226031156.000|TR0|BURTON:  What happens is a woman will 
20101226031156.000|20101226031158.000|TR0|write me a letter who is in prison and I 
20101226031158.000|20101226031200.000|TR0|will find out what day she's released.  
20101226031200.000|20101226031201.000|TR0|And I pick them up at the prison.
20101226031201.000|20101226031203.000|TR0|

20101226031255.000|20101226031257.000|TR0|

20101226031306.000|20101226031308.000|TR0|go back to school and become drug

20101226031315.000|20101226031316.000|TR0|businesses.  I'm watched them open up 
20101226031316.000|20101226031318.000|TR0|their own places to help homeless women

20101226031440.000|20101226031442.000|TR0|BURTON:  I'm so full of thanks and 
20101226031442.000|20101226031444.000|TR0|gratitude for being recognized by CNN as a 
20101226031444.000|20101226031446.000|TR0|2010 hero.  Through my life, I would have 
20101226031446.000|20101226031448.000|TR0|never imagined I'd be in the category as a 
20101226031448.000|20101226031449.000|TR0|hero.
20101226031449.000|20101226031451.000|TR0|
20101226031451.000|20101226031453.000|TR0|And all of this would not have been 
20101226031453.000|20101226031455.000|TR0|possible without George Cameron (ph).  He 
20101226031455.000|20101226031457.000|TR0|stuck by me through so many years, so many 
20101226031457.000|20101226031458.000|TR0|dark days.  And never gave up on me.  He 
20101226031458.000|20101226031500.000|TR0|took me to recovery October 4th of 1997.
20101226031500.000|20101226031502.000|TR0|
20101226031502.000|20101226031504.000|TR0|And it's because of your support that I'm 
20101226031504.000|20101226031505.000|TR0|here today.
20101226031505.000|20101226031507.000|TR0|
20101226031507.000|20101226031509.000|TR0|It's been nearly 30 years since my son's 
20101226031509.000|20101226031511.000|TR0|death.  And I miss him every day.  But I 
20101226031511.000|20101226031513.000|TR0|know, I know that he's smiling down on us, 
20101226031513.000|20101226031514.000|TR0|and that he's proud of me.
20101226031514.000|20101226031516.000|TR0|

20101226031518.000|20101226031520.000|TR0|supported me through the years, to bring 
20101226031520.000|20101226031522.000|TR0|change for a better world.

20101226031547.000|20101226031548.000|TR0|COOPER:  Welcome back to "CNN Heroes."
20101226031548.000|20101226031550.000|TR0|
20101226031550.000|20101226031552.000|TR0|Well, tonight, we're celebrating people 
20101226031552.000|20101226031554.000|TR0|who have extended a helping hand to those 
20101226031554.000|20101226031556.000|TR0|in need.  Our next hero not only extends 
20101226031556.000|20101226031557.000|TR0|his hand, he builds bridges, allowing the 
20101226031557.000|20101226031559.000|TR0|people of Kenya a safe pathway to their 
20101226031559.000|20101226031601.000|TR0|dreams.
20101226031601.000|20101226031603.000|TR0|
20101226031603.000|20101226031604.000|TR0|Here to tell this hero's story, the star 
20101226031604.000|20101226031606.000|TR0|of the upcoming film "Battle: Los 
20101226031606.000|20101226031608.000|TR0|Angeles," Aaron Eckhart.
20101226031608.000|20101226031610.000|TR0|
20101226031610.000|20101226031612.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226031612.000|20101226031613.000|TR0|
20101226031613.000|20101226031615.000|TR0|ECKHART:  On some days, I look at the news 
20101226031615.000|20101226031617.000|TR0|and the problems are so overwhelming, so 
20101226031617.000|20101226031619.000|TR0|big, it's hard to believe we can do 
20101226031619.000|20101226031621.000|TR0|anything about them to make them better.
20101226031621.000|20101226031622.000|TR0|
20101226031622.000|20101226031624.000|TR0|But then a visionary comes along -- like 
20101226031624.000|20101226031626.000|TR0|Harmon Parker, who shows us how our simple 
20101226031626.000|20101226031628.000|TR0|ideas can make a difference.  Harmon 
20101226031628.000|20101226031629.000|TR0|builds foot bridges.  They're beautiful 
20101226031629.000|20101226031631.000|TR0|things.  They are basic in design, 
20101226031631.000|20101226031633.000|TR0|magnificent in purpose, and they save 
20101226031633.000|20101226031635.000|TR0|lives.
20101226031635.000|20101226031637.000|TR0|
20101226031637.000|20101226031638.000|TR0|In rural Kenya, a river is a lethal place. 
20101226031638.000|20101226031640.000|TR0| People drown in floodwaters and are 
20101226031640.000|20101226031642.000|TR0|killed in attacks by crocodiles and hippos 
20101226031642.000|20101226031644.000|TR0|because there isn't a bridge.
20101226031644.000|20101226031646.000|TR0|
20101226031646.000|20101226031647.000|TR0|So, Harmon built them, 45, so people won't 
20101226031647.000|20101226031649.000|TR0|die, won't go hungry, get sick and so kids 
20101226031649.000|20101226031651.000|TR0|can go to school.  A foot bridge did all 
20101226031651.000|20101226031653.000|TR0|that.  A simple thing can change lives.  
20101226031653.000|20101226031655.000|TR0|And that's what heroes do.
20101226031655.000|20101226031656.000|TR0|
20101226031656.000|20101226031658.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226031658.000|20101226031700.000|TR0|
20101226031700.000|20101226031702.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101226031702.000|20101226031703.000|TR0|
20101226031703.000|20101226031705.000|TR0|HARMON PARKER, CNN HERO:  Because of the 
20101226031705.000|20101226031707.000|TR0|high mountains, there is serious flash 
20101226031707.000|20101226031709.000|TR0|flooding that happens in this area.  You 
20101226031709.000|20101226031711.000|TR0|see the stream the way it is now, it will 
20101226031711.000|20101226031712.000|TR0|come up 12 to 15 feet and it's impossible 
20101226031712.000|20101226031714.000|TR0|for people to cross, absolutely impossible 
20101226031714.000|20101226031716.000|TR0|and extremely dangerous.
20101226031716.000|20101226031718.000|TR0|
20101226031718.000|20101226031720.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  She drowned due to 
20101226031720.000|20101226031721.000|TR0|floods caused by a heavy downpour.  She 
20101226031721.000|20101226031723.000|TR0|got carried downstream by water and was 
20101226031723.000|20101226031725.000|TR0|later pushed ashore dead.  This is how I 
20101226031725.000|20101226031727.000|TR0|got left with the children.
20101226031727.000|20101226031728.000|TR0|
20101226031728.000|20101226031730.000|TR0|PARKER:  Many years ago, in 1985, I had 
20101226031730.000|20101226031732.000|TR0|the opportunity to go to the Congo just to 
20101226031732.000|20101226031734.000|TR0|help some missionaries build a house and 
20101226031734.000|20101226031736.000|TR0|little did I know it would change my life 
20101226031736.000|20101226031737.000|TR0|forever.
20101226031737.000|20101226031739.000|TR0|
20101226031739.000|20101226031741.000|TR0|We are an organization that builds foot 
20101226031741.000|20101226031743.000|TR0|bridges throughout Kenya for marginalized 
20101226031743.000|20101226031745.000|TR0|communities who really suffer from the 
20101226031745.000|20101226031746.000|TR0|dangers of flash flooding and from 
20101226031746.000|20101226031748.000|TR0|crocodile and hippo attacks.
20101226031748.000|20101226031750.000|TR0|
20101226031750.000|20101226031752.000|TR0|People ask me, why don't they build their 
20101226031752.000|20101226031753.000|TR0|own bridge?  Well, the community, they do 
20101226031753.000|20101226031755.000|TR0|the best they can with the limited 
20101226031755.000|20101226031757.000|TR0|resources and technology that they have.  
20101226031757.000|20101226031759.000|TR0|And they build a bridge like this and it's 
20101226031759.000|20101226031801.000|TR0|fine, but it's also is washed away 
20101226031801.000|20101226031802.000|TR0|probably seven times a year.  It cuts off 
20101226031802.000|20101226031804.000|TR0|the children from going to school, people 
20101226031804.000|20101226031806.000|TR0|to the market centers and getting to the

20101226032034.000|20101226032036.000|TR0|ANDERSON COOPER, CNN HOST:  When you step 
20101226032036.000|20101226032038.000|TR0|into the murder capital of the world, you 
20101226032038.000|20101226032040.000|TR0|don't expect to see much hope.  But in the 
20101226032040.000|20101226032041.000|TR0|blood-soaked city of Juarez, Mexico, one

20101226032058.000|20101226032059.000|TR0|JESSICA ALBA, PRESENTER:  I grew up with a

20101226032101.000|20101226032103.000|TR0|aunts and grandmothers.  These women 
20101226032103.000|20101226032105.000|TR0|taught me about resilience, compassion and 
20101226032105.000|20101226032107.000|TR0|perseverance.  The woman I'm here to honor 
20101226032107.000|20101226032108.000|TR0|tonight embodies all of these qualities.  
20101226032108.000|20101226032110.000|TR0|Her name is Guadalupe Arizpe De La Vega.  
20101226032110.000|20101226032112.000|TR0|Guadalupe reaches out to save the poorest 
20101226032112.000|20101226032114.000|TR0|and most destitute women and their 
20101226032114.000|20101226032115.000|TR0|families in the war-stricken city of 
20101226032115.000|20101226032117.000|TR0|Juarez, Mexico.  There, la senora runs her 
20101226032117.000|20101226032119.000|TR0|hospital, a sanctuary, that celebrates 
20101226032119.000|20101226032121.000|TR0|life, hope and love.
20101226032121.000|20101226032123.000|TR0|
20101226032123.000|20101226032124.000|TR0|For more than 30 years, her hospital has 
20101226032124.000|20101226032126.000|TR0|offered free medical care to anyone in 
20101226032126.000|20101226032128.000|TR0|need.  And in a city ravaged by death, the 
20101226032128.000|20101226032130.000|TR0|hospital has delivered more than 104,000 
20101226032130.000|20101226032132.000|TR0|babies.  Life, love and hope in the midst 
20101226032132.000|20101226032133.000|TR0|of so much heartache.  It is this passion

20101226032211.000|20101226032213.000|TR0|DE LA VEGA:  I was driving under a bridge.

20101226032214.000|20101226032216.000|TR0|man without a head, and the blood was

20101226032218.000|20101226032220.000|TR0|it's dangerous.  Sometimes I believe that

20101226032252.000|20101226032254.000|TR0|difficult to keep the pace of her.
20101226032254.000|20101226032256.000|TR0|
20101226032256.000|20101226032257.000|TR0|DE LA VEGA:  We started up our program in 
20101226032257.000|20101226032259.000|TR0|1973.  Empowering women. Giving them the 
20101226032259.000|20101226032301.000|TR0|power to control their reproductive lives. 
20101226032301.000|20101226032303.000|TR0| So we started providing services in one 
20101226032303.000|20101226032304.000|TR0|of the clinics.  Then in two clinics.  
20101226032304.000|20101226032306.000|TR0|Then in four clinics.  Then the clinics 
20101226032306.000|20101226032308.000|TR0|grow.  Every day, we have from 800 to 
20101226032308.000|20101226032310.000|TR0|1,000 people.  Some of them can pay.  Some 
20101226032310.000|20101226032312.000|TR0|of them cannot pay.  But we don't turn 
20101226032312.000|20101226032313.000|TR0|anybody away.

20101226032839.000|20101226032840.000|TR0|COOPER:  We're back on "CNN Heroes." If 
20101226032840.000|20101226032842.000|TR0|you didn't have to struggle for food 
20101226032842.000|20101226032844.000|TR0|today, you're one of the lucky people on 
20101226032844.000|20101226032846.000|TR0|this planet.  Our next hero got a painful 
20101226032846.000|20101226032848.000|TR0|reminder of that fact.  His path was 
20101226032848.000|20101226032849.000|TR0|forever changed from five star chef of an 
20101226032849.000|20101226032851.000|TR0|upscale hotel to a soldier in the war 
20101226032851.000|20101226032853.000|TR0|against hunger.  To tell us how one man 
20101226032853.000|20101226032855.000|TR0|can nourish the bodies and spirits of 
20101226032855.000|20101226032857.000|TR0|many, here's the support of the Global 
20101226032857.000|20101226032858.000|TR0|Fund for Women, Kiefer Sutherland.
20101226032858.000|20101226032900.000|TR0|
20101226032900.000|20101226032902.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226032902.000|20101226032904.000|TR0|
20101226032904.000|20101226032905.000|TR0|KIEFER SUTHERLAND, PRESENTER:  Every 
20101226032905.000|20101226032907.000|TR0|single one of us has seen something so 
20101226032907.000|20101226032909.000|TR0|devastating that it has broken us.  Maybe 
20101226032909.000|20101226032911.000|TR0|it's something quiet.  A mother kissing 
20101226032911.000|20101226032913.000|TR0|her kids goodnight in the back of her old 
20101226032913.000|20101226032914.000|TR0|station wagon or something even more 
20101226032914.000|20101226032916.000|TR0|shocking, a man literally starving to 
20101226032916.000|20101226032918.000|TR0|death on the street.  And when we see 
20101226032918.000|20101226032920.000|TR0|things like this, most of us feel it 
20101226032920.000|20101226032922.000|TR0|deeply.  But we manage to pull ourselves 
20101226032922.000|20101226032923.000|TR0|back together and go on with our lives.  
20101226032923.000|20101226032925.000|TR0|But thank God there are people on this 
20101226032925.000|20101226032927.000|TR0|planet like Narayanan Krishnan who cannot. 
20101226032927.000|20101226032929.000|TR0| He comes from a life of privilege but he 
20101226032929.000|20101226032931.000|TR0|shuns the cultural belief that some in 
20101226032931.000|20101226032932.000|TR0|India that says that men and women who are 
20101226032932.000|20101226032934.000|TR0|destitute, homeless, struggling or 
20101226032934.000|20101226032936.000|TR0|suffering from mental illness are 
20101226032936.000|20101226032938.000|TR0|untouchables, unworthy of compassion.  But 
20101226032938.000|20101226032939.000|TR0|he sees them as equal.  That is why he 
20101226032939.000|20101226032941.000|TR0|cooks for them, feeds them, cares for them 
20101226032941.000|20101226032943.000|TR0|and offers them the simple dignity of a 
20101226032943.000|20101226032945.000|TR0|bath.  The sight of the hungry, the sick 
20101226032945.000|20101226032947.000|TR0|and the homeless broke his heart to 
20101226032947.000|20101226032948.000|TR0|pieces.  But he took those pieces and 
20101226032948.000|20101226032950.000|TR0|built a life for himself, helping people 
20101226032950.000|20101226032952.000|TR0|in need as their friend.
20101226032952.000|20101226032954.000|TR0|
20101226032954.000|20101226032956.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101226032956.000|20101226032957.000|TR0|
20101226032957.000|20101226032959.000|TR0|NARAYANAN KRISHNAN:  I saw a very old man. 
20101226032959.000|20101226033001.000|TR0| He was eating his own human waste for 
20101226033001.000|20101226033003.000|TR0|hunger.  I thought, what is the purpose of 
20101226033003.000|20101226033004.000|TR0|my life? What am I going to do?
20101226033004.000|20101226033006.000|TR0|
20101226033006.000|20101226033008.000|TR0|In a star hotel, I feed all my guests.  
20101226033008.000|20101226033010.000|TR0|But where in my hometown there are people 
20101226033010.000|20101226033012.000|TR0|who are living even without food.  I quit 
20101226033012.000|20101226033013.000|TR0|my job and I started feeding all these 
20101226033013.000|20101226033015.000|TR0|people from 2002.
20101226033015.000|20101226033017.000|TR0|
20101226033017.000|20101226033019.000|TR0|Today morning, we made Ven Pongal and 
20101226033019.000|20101226033021.000|TR0|Sambar.  Ven Pongal is a blend of rice and 
20101226033021.000|20101226033022.000|TR0|dahl.  And for lunch we made tomato rice 
20101226033022.000|20101226033024.000|TR0|and Sabji.  We feed the homeless, 
20101226033024.000|20101226033026.000|TR0|mentally-ill destitutes and the old people 
20101226033026.000|20101226033028.000|TR0|who have been left uncared of the society.
20101226033028.000|20101226033030.000|TR0|
20101226033030.000|20101226033031.000|TR0|People are suffering for food.  They don't 
20101226033031.000|20101226033033.000|TR0|have food to eat.  If you don't give them 
20101226033033.000|20101226033035.000|TR0|food to eat, they will die out of human 
20101226033035.000|20101226033037.000|TR0|hunger.
20101226033037.000|20101226033038.000|TR0|
20101226033038.000|20101226033040.000|TR0|I cut their hair.  I give them a shave.  I 
20101226033040.000|20101226033042.000|TR0|give them bath.  For them to feel, 
20101226033042.000|20101226033044.000|TR0|psychologically, that they are also human 
20101226033044.000|20101226033046.000|TR0|beings, there are people to care for them. 
20101226033046.000|20101226033047.000|TR0| They have a hand to hold, hope to live.
20101226033047.000|20101226033049.000|TR0|
20101226033049.000|20101226033051.000|TR0|Food is one part.  Love is another part.  
20101226033051.000|20101226033053.000|TR0|So the food will give them physical 
20101226033053.000|20101226033055.000|TR0|nutrition.  The love and affection which 
20101226033055.000|20101226033056.000|TR0|you show will give them mental nutrition.
20101226033056.000|20101226033058.000|TR0|
20101226033058.000|20101226033100.000|TR0|Brahmins are not supposed to touch these 
20101226033100.000|20101226033102.000|TR0|people, clean these people, hug these 
20101226033102.000|20101226033103.000|TR0|people, feed these people.  Everybody has 
20101226033103.000|20101226033105.000|TR0|got five liters of blood.  I'm just a 
20101226033105.000|20101226033107.000|TR0|human being.  For me, everybody the same.  
20101226033107.000|20101226033109.000|TR0|What is the ultimate purpose of life?  
20101226033109.000|20101226033111.000|TR0|It's to give.  Start giving.  See the joy 
20101226033111.000|20101226033112.000|TR0|of giving.
20101226033112.000|20101226033114.000|TR0|
20101226033114.000|20101226033116.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226033116.000|20101226033118.000|TR0|
20101226033118.000|20101226033120.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)
20101226033120.000|20101226033121.000|TR0|
20101226033121.000|20101226033123.000|TR0|SUTHERLAND:  Ladies and gentlemen, it is 
20101226033123.000|20101226033125.000|TR0|my honor to present CNN hero Narayanan 
20101226033125.000|20101226033127.000|TR0|Krishnan.
20101226033127.000|20101226033128.000|TR0|
20101226033128.000|20101226033130.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226033130.000|20101226033132.000|TR0|
20101226033132.000|20101226033134.000|TR0|NARAYANAN KRISHNAN:  Thank you so much, 
20101226033134.000|20101226033136.000|TR0|CNN for this global recognition.  I want 
20101226033136.000|20101226033137.000|TR0|to thank my father for his support.
20101226033137.000|20101226033139.000|TR0|
20101226033139.000|20101226033141.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226033141.000|20101226033143.000|TR0|
20101226033143.000|20101226033145.000|TR0|This is the right path I have taken.  The 
20101226033145.000|20101226033146.000|TR0|people I feed are my friends and bring my 
20101226033146.000|20101226033148.000|TR0|inner joy no joy could ever could.  
20101226033148.000|20101226033150.000|TR0|Clarity and focus are needed to know our 
20101226033150.000|20101226033152.000|TR0|destination.  I know mine.  I will 
20101226033152.000|20101226033154.000|TR0|continue to go to the streets again and 
20101226033154.000|20101226033155.000|TR0|feed these people because they need us. 
20101226033155.000|20101226033157.000|TR0|Thank you, one and all.
20101226033157.000|20101226033159.000|TR0|
20101226033159.000|20101226033201.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226033201.000|20101226033202.000|TR0|
20101226033202.000|20101226033204.000|TR0|COOPER:  Sometimes heroes are driven by a 
20101226033204.000|20101226033206.000|TR0|simple desire to help their fellowmen.  
20101226033206.000|20101226033208.000|TR0|Our next hero's quest, however, is 
20101226033208.000|20101226033210.000|TR0|inspired by his own story.  A history of 
20101226033210.000|20101226033211.000|TR0|violence that he is determined to erase.  
20101226033211.000|20101226033213.000|TR0|The story of redemption is shared with us 
20101226033213.000|20101226033215.000|TR0|by a proud member of the Children's 
20101226033215.000|20101226033217.000|TR0|Defense Fund, Renee Zellweger.
20101226033217.000|20101226033219.000|TR0|
20101226033219.000|20101226033220.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226033220.000|20101226033222.000|TR0|
20101226033222.000|20101226033224.000|TR0|RENEE ZELLWEGER, PRESENTER:  No one is 
20101226033224.000|20101226033226.000|TR0|perfect.  All of us are flawed and in need 
20101226033226.000|20101226033227.000|TR0|of redemption in one way or another.  Some 
20101226033227.000|20101226033229.000|TR0|of our indiscretions are small.  And 
20101226033229.000|20101226033231.000|TR0|usually an apology can set things right. 
20101226033231.000|20101226033233.000|TR0|But other acts are so painful that 
20101226033233.000|20101226033235.000|TR0|redemption seems nearly impossible. In 
20101226033235.000|20101226033236.000|TR0|those cases, it just takes your breath 
20101226033236.000|20101226033238.000|TR0|away when someone is brave enough to try 
20101226033238.000|20101226033240.000|TR0|and right a wrong.
20101226033240.000|20101226033242.000|TR0|
20101226033242.000|20101226033244.000|TR0|This is what Aki Ra does every day in 
20101226033244.000|20101226033245.000|TR0|Cambodia.  He quietly walks through the 
20101226033245.000|20101226033247.000|TR0|villages, searching the ground, getting on 
20101226033247.000|20101226033249.000|TR0|his hands and knees, to clear land mines.  
20101226033249.000|20101226033251.000|TR0|Landmines that he was forced as a child 
20101226033251.000|20101226033252.000|TR0|soldier for the Khmer Rouge to bury.  So 
20101226033252.000|20101226033254.000|TR0|far, he's removed 50,000 mines.
20101226033254.000|20101226033256.000|TR0|
20101226033256.000|20101226033258.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226033258.000|20101226033300.000|TR0|
20101226033300.000|20101226033301.000|TR0|But that's not all he does.  When he walks 
20101226033301.000|20101226033303.000|TR0|through the villages, he meets children 
20101226033303.000|20101226033305.000|TR0|who've lost limbs and parents to mines.  
20101226033305.000|20101226033307.000|TR0|So he built a home for 30 orphans and says 
20101226033307.000|20101226033309.000|TR0|I will love you as my own.  Redemption is 
20101226033309.000|20101226033310.000|TR0|beautiful, dangerous, never-ending work.  
20101226033310.000|20101226033312.000|TR0|And a hero never fears it.
20101226033312.000|20101226033314.000|TR0|
20101226033314.000|20101226033316.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226033316.000|20101226033318.000|TR0|
20101226033318.000|20101226033319.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101226033319.000|20101226033321.000|TR0|
20101226033321.000|20101226033323.000|TR0|AKI RA, CAMBODIAN SELF HELP DEMINING:  
20101226033323.000|20101226033325.000|TR0|When we use a metal detector to find a 
20101226033325.000|20101226033326.000|TR0|mine, we move a little bit by a little 
20101226033326.000|20101226033328.000|TR0|bit.  If we make mistake with the 
20101226033328.000|20101226033330.000|TR0|landmine, blow up -- kill or injure.  When 
20101226033330.000|20101226033332.000|TR0|we hear something that sounds like mine, 
20101226033332.000|20101226033334.000|TR0|we have to prod it slowly.  And dig it 
20101226033334.000|20101226033335.000|TR0|slowly.
20101226033335.000|20101226033337.000|TR0|
20101226033337.000|20101226033339.000|TR0|Many, many thousand landmine I clear.  I 
20101226033339.000|20101226033341.000|TR0|am hundred  percent safe, I think.
20101226033341.000|20101226033343.000|TR0|
20101226033343.000|20101226033344.000|TR0|When I was young, Khmer Rouge killed my 
20101226033344.000|20101226033346.000|TR0|family.  I was then taken to live with 
20101226033346.000|20101226033348.000|TR0|Khmer Rouge.

20101226033357.000|20101226033359.000|TR0|didn't know the difference between right 
20101226033359.000|20101226033400.000|TR0|and wrong.  I did bad things.  Now I'm 
20101226033400.000|20101226033402.000|TR0|older, I've learned a lot.  Many children 
20101226033402.000|20101226033404.000|TR0|have been hurt by landmines.

20101226033730.000|20101226033731.000|TR0|state, she got out her chisel and she went

20101226033733.000|20101226033735.000|TR0|and challenged the city to lose 17,000 
20101226033735.000|20101226033737.000|TR0|pounds.

20101226033933.000|20101226033935.000|TR0|delicious.  But Mississippi has carried 
20101226033935.000|20101226033936.000|TR0|the title of being the most obese state 
20101226033936.000|20101226033938.000|TR0|for six consecutive years.  Two out of 
20101226033938.000|20101226033940.000|TR0|every three adults are either overweight

20101226033949.000|20101226033951.000|TR0|to make sure we're doing right so I have

20101226033952.000|20101226033954.000|TR0|
20101226033954.000|20101226033956.000|TR0|FONDREN:  The reason why I am so 
20101226033956.000|20101226033958.000|TR0|passionate about this is because my sister 
20101226033958.000|20101226034000.000|TR0|passed away in January of 2006 and she was 
20101226034000.000|20101226034001.000|TR0|restricted because of obesity.  She worked 
20101226034001.000|20101226034003.000|TR0|in this school cafeteria just like you.
20101226034003.000|20101226034005.000|TR0|
20101226034005.000|20101226034007.000|TR0|And she did not get to live her life.  She 
20101226034007.000|20101226034009.000|TR0|wished she had lived it better.  But now 
20101226034009.000|20101226034010.000|TR0|you have that chance to make a difference

20101226034012.000|20101226034014.000|TR0|commitment.  You ready?  You already made 
20101226034014.000|20101226034016.000|TR0|the commitment.  Sign the form.

20101226034307.000|20101226034309.000|TR0|
20101226034309.000|20101226034311.000|TR0|Most of us think as coming home as a 
20101226034311.000|20101226034313.000|TR0|pleasant end to the day unless of course

20101226034316.000|20101226034318.000|TR0|
20101226034318.000|20101226034320.000|TR0|(LAUGHTER)
20101226034320.000|20101226034322.000|TR0|
20101226034322.000|20101226034323.000|TR0|COOPER:  It's said out of love.  It's said 
20101226034323.000|20101226034325.000|TR0|out of love.
20101226034325.000|20101226034327.000|TR0|
20101226034327.000|20101226034329.000|TR0|But for soldiers returning from war, 
20101226034329.000|20101226034331.000|TR0|coming home can often be a battle.  All 
20101226034331.000|20101226034332.000|TR0|too often the men and women who fight to 
20101226034332.000|20101226034334.000|TR0|defend our comfortable lives do not even 
20101226034334.000|20101226034336.000|TR0|have a house of their own to return to.
20101226034336.000|20101226034338.000|TR0|
20101226034338.000|20101226034339.000|TR0|One man, however, is building them a 
20101226034339.000|20101226034341.000|TR0|better future brick by brick.
20101226034341.000|20101226034343.000|TR0|
20101226034343.000|20101226034345.000|TR0|To tell this hero's story please welcome, 
20101226034345.000|20101226034347.000|TR0|proud supporter of Operation Home Front, 
20101226034347.000|20101226034348.000|TR0|who just released his new album, "Born 
20101226034348.000|20101226034350.000|TR0|Free," Kid Rock.
20101226034350.000|20101226034352.000|TR0|
20101226034352.000|20101226034354.000|TR0|(CHEERS AND APPLAUSE)
20101226034354.000|20101226034356.000|TR0|
20101226034356.000|20101226034357.000|TR0|KID ROCK, SINGER:  A couple of months ago, 
20101226034357.000|20101226034359.000|TR0|I gave a concert for the troops of Fort 
20101226034359.000|20101226034401.000|TR0|Jackson, South Carolina.  When I look out 
20101226034401.000|20101226034403.000|TR0|at the crowd and saw all those uniforms it 
20101226034403.000|20101226034404.000|TR0|made me very proud.  We're so lucky these 
20101226034404.000|20101226034406.000|TR0|brave, honorable men and women say yes, 
20101226034406.000|20101226034408.000|TR0|I'll serve.
20101226034408.000|20101226034410.000|TR0|
20101226034410.000|20101226034412.000|TR0|But for too many veterans, coming home is 
20101226034412.000|20101226034413.000|TR0|a struggle.  Many have been wounded and 
20101226034413.000|20101226034415.000|TR0|they either can't afford a house or their 
20101226034415.000|20101226034417.000|TR0|house doesn't fit them anymore.  The halls 
20101226034417.000|20101226034419.000|TR0|are too thin for a wheelchair.  The stairs 
20101226034419.000|20101226034421.000|TR0|too steep for prosthetics.
20101226034421.000|20101226034422.000|TR0|
20101226034422.000|20101226034424.000|TR0|So Dan Wallrath says this.  I'll serve the 
20101226034424.000|20101226034426.000|TR0|heroes.  This great Texan builds them a 
20101226034426.000|20101226034428.000|TR0|brand-new house.
20101226034428.000|20101226034430.000|TR0|
20101226034430.000|20101226034431.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226034431.000|20101226034433.000|TR0|
20101226034433.000|20101226034435.000|TR0|KID ROCK:  Dan started Operation Finally 
20101226034435.000|20101226034437.000|TR0|Home and works with builders, contractors 
20101226034437.000|20101226034438.000|TR0|and developers to design custom homes for 
20101226034438.000|20101226034440.000|TR0|wounded veterans for free.  And when they 
20101226034440.000|20101226034442.000|TR0|turn the key for the first time, Dan's 
20101226034442.000|20101226034444.000|TR0|right there, holding the door, saying 
20101226034444.000|20101226034446.000|TR0|"welcome home."
20101226034446.000|20101226034447.000|TR0|
20101226034447.000|20101226034449.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) DAN WALLRATH, 2010 TOP 
20101226034449.000|20101226034451.000|TR0|10 CNN HERO, OPERATION FINALLY HOME:  I 
20101226034451.000|20101226034453.000|TR0|built homes in and around the Houston area 
20101226034453.000|20101226034455.000|TR0|for around 30 years.  One day, I got a 
20101226034455.000|20101226034456.000|TR0|phone call from a friend of mine.  And he 
20101226034456.000|20101226034458.000|TR0|knew of a family that had had a son that 
20101226034458.000|20101226034500.000|TR0|was coming home from Iraq and he had 
20101226034500.000|20101226034502.000|TR0|sustained head injuries.
20101226034502.000|20101226034503.000|TR0|
20101226034503.000|20101226034505.000|TR0|And he asked me if I'd go and talk to the 
20101226034505.000|20101226034507.000|TR0|family.  So I went to their home and the 
20101226034507.000|20101226034509.000|TR0|father was there.  He had shown me a 
20101226034509.000|20101226034511.000|TR0|picture of Steven before he was injured.  
20101226034511.000|20101226034512.000|TR0|He was just a big strapping Marine.  And 
20101226034512.000|20101226034514.000|TR0|then showed me a picture of Steven after 
20101226034514.000|20101226034516.000|TR0|he was injured in his wheelchair. And it 
20101226034516.000|20101226034518.000|TR0|just -- it just broke my heart.
20101226034518.000|20101226034520.000|TR0|
20101226034520.000|20101226034521.000|TR0|I had to do something.
20101226034521.000|20101226034523.000|TR0|
20101226034523.000|20101226034525.000|TR0|This is a five-bedroom house so every one 
20101226034525.000|20101226034527.000|TR0|of your kids will have a bedroom.  All the 
20101226034527.000|20101226034528.000|TR0|hallways are just really wide.  It gives 
20101226034528.000|20101226034530.000|TR0|you a lot more room to move around.  We 
20101226034530.000|20101226034532.000|TR0|want to make sure that we take into 
20101226034532.000|20101226034534.000|TR0|consideration all their needs.
20101226034534.000|20101226034536.000|TR0|
20101226034536.000|20101226034537.000|TR0|SGT. JORGE DE LEON, VETERAN:  In my case, 
20101226034537.000|20101226034539.000|TR0|I lost my leg when I was 31 years old.  
20101226034539.000|20101226034541.000|TR0|And you have to learn how to walk again.  
20101226034541.000|20101226034543.000|TR0|It was really hard.  And then financially, 
20101226034543.000|20101226034545.000|TR0|emotionally, I will never, never having 
20101226034545.000|20101226034546.000|TR0|the money to buy a house like this, and I 
20101226034546.000|20101226034548.000|TR0|got it for free.
20101226034548.000|20101226034550.000|TR0|
20101226034550.000|20101226034552.000|TR0|WALLRATH:  You know, we can give them a 
20101226034552.000|20101226034554.000|TR0|lot of things.  A lot of help in different 
20101226034554.000|20101226034555.000|TR0|ways.  We can give them counseling and 
20101226034555.000|20101226034557.000|TR0|everything else. But nothing compares to a 
20101226034557.000|20101226034559.000|TR0|home.
20101226034559.000|20101226034601.000|TR0|
20101226034601.000|20101226034602.000|TR0|Every time I do this, it doesn't get any 
20101226034602.000|20101226034604.000|TR0|less emotional.  As Americans, we owe it 
20101226034604.000|20101226034606.000|TR0|to them.
20101226034606.000|20101226034608.000|TR0|
20101226034608.000|20101226034610.000|TR0|AIRMAN COLTON REED, VETERAN:  A house is 
20101226034610.000|20101226034611.000|TR0|everything.  It's my livelihood back.  I 
20101226034611.000|20101226034613.000|TR0|don't know what else you could give 
20101226034613.000|20101226034615.000|TR0|somebody other than a house, a home.
20101226034615.000|20101226034617.000|TR0|
20101226034617.000|20101226034619.000|TR0|WALLRATH:  There's over 38,000 young men

20101226034620.000|20101226034622.000|TR0|Those young men need our help but 
20101226034622.000|20101226034624.000|TR0|unfortunately as a builder, I don't know

20101226034804.000|20101226034806.000|TR0|efforts brighten our world.  Our next hero 
20101226034806.000|20101226034808.000|TR0|perhaps has brought more light than all.
20101226034808.000|20101226034809.000|TR0|
20101226034809.000|20101226034811.000|TR0|To tell us his radiant story, please 
20101226034811.000|20101226034813.000|TR0|welcome proud supporter of the Genesis 
20101226034813.000|20101226034815.000|TR0|Center and star of the upcoming film 
20101226034815.000|20101226034816.000|TR0|"Frankie And Alice," Halle Berry.
20101226034816.000|20101226034818.000|TR0|
20101226034818.000|20101226034820.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226034820.000|20101226034822.000|TR0|
20101226034822.000|20101226034824.000|TR0|HALLE BERRY, ACTRESS:  Thank you.
20101226034824.000|20101226034825.000|TR0|
20101226034825.000|20101226034827.000|TR0|Let me tell you what happens when darkness 
20101226034827.000|20101226034829.000|TR0|settles in around rural Kenya.  Some 
20101226034829.000|20101226034831.000|TR0|children crowd around a tiny kerosene lamp 
20101226034831.000|20101226034833.000|TR0|while others crowd around the fireside to 
20101226034833.000|20101226034834.000|TR0|do their homework.  Other children go to 
20101226034834.000|20101226034836.000|TR0|school night because they work all day.
20101226034836.000|20101226034838.000|TR0|
20101226034838.000|20101226034840.000|TR0|But in both places, the learning is very 
20101226034840.000|20101226034842.000|TR0|difficult.  The smoke burns their eyes.  
20101226034842.000|20101226034843.000|TR0|And when the fuel or wood burns out, the 
20101226034843.000|20101226034845.000|TR0|learning stops. The chance to dream also 
20101226034845.000|20101226034847.000|TR0|stops.
20101226034847.000|20101226034849.000|TR0|
20101226034849.000|20101226034850.000|TR0|But an amazing young man, Evans Wadongo, 
20101226034850.000|20101226034852.000|TR0|found a way to solve this problem.  He 
20101226034852.000|20101226034854.000|TR0|made the children a glorious lantern using 
20101226034854.000|20101226034856.000|TR0|scrap metal, small silver panels, 
20101226034856.000|20101226034858.000|TR0|inexpensive batteries and LED lights.
20101226034858.000|20101226034859.000|TR0|
20101226034859.000|20101226034901.000|TR0|So far, he's built 14,000 lanterns 
20101226034901.000|20101226034903.000|TR0|bringing light to 50,000 Kenyans for free.
20101226034903.000|20101226034905.000|TR0|
20101226034905.000|20101226034907.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE) BERRY:  Because of what Evans 
20101226034907.000|20101226034908.000|TR0|made, I can imagine thousands of children 
20101226034908.000|20101226034910.000|TR0|across rural Kenya carrying their lantern, 
20101226034910.000|20101226034912.000|TR0|singing the universal song, "This little 
20101226034912.000|20101226034914.000|TR0|light of mine, I'm going to let it shine, 
20101226034914.000|20101226034915.000|TR0|let it shine, let it shine, let it shine".
20101226034915.000|20101226034917.000|TR0|
20101226034917.000|20101226034919.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226034919.000|20101226034921.000|TR0|
20101226034921.000|20101226034923.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20101226034923.000|20101226034924.000|TR0|
20101226034924.000|20101226034926.000|TR0|EVANS WADONGO, 2010 TOP 10 CNN HERO:  I 
20101226034926.000|20101226034928.000|TR0|used to see the disparities, in terms of 
20101226034928.000|20101226034930.000|TR0|performance in school for kids that are in 
20101226034930.000|20101226034932.000|TR0|the village and the kids that are in the 
20101226034932.000|20101226034933.000|TR0|schools that have electricity.  Teachers 
20101226034933.000|20101226034935.000|TR0|would give you homework and they expect 
20101226034935.000|20101226034937.000|TR0|you to have done it the next day morning.  
20101226034937.000|20101226034939.000|TR0|The teacher can't understand that you 
20101226034939.000|20101226034940.000|TR0|didn't have enough kerosene at home.
20101226034940.000|20101226034942.000|TR0|
20101226034942.000|20101226034944.000|TR0|If you look at a person who is earning 
20101226034944.000|20101226034946.000|TR0|less than a dollar a day, and that's money 
20101226034946.000|20101226034948.000|TR0|to have to get food -- they have to buy 
20101226034948.000|20101226034949.000|TR0|kerosene, it's a big burden for these 
20101226034949.000|20101226034951.000|TR0|people.  Kerosene lamps, because you have 
20101226034951.000|20101226034953.000|TR0|to read, so you put it on the table very 
20101226034953.000|20101226034955.000|TR0|close.  It produces smoke, which goes into 
20101226034955.000|20101226034957.000|TR0|my eyes, so I developed eye problems.  I 
20101226034957.000|20101226034958.000|TR0|saw kids in the village, some of them 
20101226034958.000|20101226035000.000|TR0|dropping out of school.
20101226035000.000|20101226035002.000|TR0|
20101226035002.000|20101226035004.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  Traditionally, 
20101226035004.000|20101226035006.000|TR0|school in Kenya runs between 8:00 a.m. in 
20101226035006.000|20101226035007.000|TR0|the morning to 5:00 p.m. in the evening.  
20101226035007.000|20101226035009.000|TR0|This is a time when children in Samburu 
20101226035009.000|20101226035011.000|TR0|culture have to take care of the animals.
20101226035011.000|20101226035013.000|TR0|
20101226035013.000|20101226035014.000|TR0|(SINGING)
20101226035014.000|20101226035016.000|TR0|
20101226035016.000|20101226035018.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  In the evening, they 
20101226035018.000|20101226035020.000|TR0|come at around 6:00.  Classes start when 
20101226035020.000|20101226035022.000|TR0|the darkness starts.  You cannot have a 
20101226035022.000|20101226035023.000|TR0|shepherd to class without lighting.
20101226035023.000|20101226035025.000|TR0|
20101226035025.000|20101226035027.000|TR0|WADONGO:  The real motivation that made me 
20101226035027.000|20101226035029.000|TR0|to come to try and see if I can come up 
20101226035029.000|20101226035031.000|TR0|with a solution.  I design and make solar 
20101226035031.000|20101226035032.000|TR0|powered lanterns called MwangaBora (ph),  
20101226035032.000|20101226035034.000|TR0|which is a Swahili word which means good 
20101226035034.000|20101226035036.000|TR0|light.  I design and study making solar 
20101226035036.000|20101226035038.000|TR0|lamps in 2004.  And up to now, made local 
20101226035038.000|20101226035039.000|TR0|and distributed over 14,000 lamps.
20101226035039.000|20101226035041.000|TR0|
20101226035041.000|20101226035043.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  My vision is that 
20101226035043.000|20101226035045.000|TR0|we'll be able to provide a lamp per child.
20101226035045.000|20101226035047.000|TR0|
20101226035047.000|20101226035048.000|TR0|WADONGO:  The villages where we've taken 
20101226035048.000|20101226035050.000|TR0|the lamps to, we've noticed a big 
20101226035050.000|20101226035052.000|TR0|improvement now, because we find that 
20101226035052.000|20101226035054.000|TR0|enrollment from elementary school to high 
20101226035054.000|20101226035056.000|TR0|school has gone up.  Now, once get the 
20101226035056.000|20101226035057.000|TR0|lamp, we're eliminating part of that money 
20101226035057.000|20101226035059.000|TR0|they spend on kerosene.
20101226035059.000|20101226035101.000|TR0|
20101226035101.000|20101226035103.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  Then they can be

20101226035212.000|20101226035214.000|TR0|COOPER:  Welcome back to CNN HEROES.  
20101226035214.000|20101226035216.000|TR0|Perhaps one of the most disturbing crimes 
20101226035216.000|20101226035218.000|TR0|that we see today is the exploitation and 
20101226035218.000|20101226035220.000|TR0|trafficking of children as sex slaves.  In 
20101226035220.000|20101226035221.000|TR0|India, for instance, 2.8 million people 
20101226035221.000|20101226035223.000|TR0|are sold in the sex trade, and more than 
20101226035223.000|20101226035225.000|TR0|one-third of them are under the age of 18. 
20101226035225.000|20101226035227.000|TR0| Our next hero fights to end this horrible 
20101226035227.000|20101226035228.000|TR0|brutality and bring some solace to the 
20101226035228.000|20101226035230.000|TR0|girls that she rescued.
20101226035230.000|20101226035232.000|TR0|
20101226035232.000|20101226035234.000|TR0|Here to introduce us to her is founder of 
20101226035234.000|20101226035236.000|TR0|the DNA Foundation, which aims to 
20101226035236.000|20101226035237.000|TR0|eliminate child sex slavery worldwide, 
20101226035237.000|20101226035239.000|TR0|Demi Moore.
20101226035239.000|20101226035241.000|TR0|
20101226035241.000|20101226035243.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226035243.000|20101226035245.000|TR0|
20101226035245.000|20101226035246.000|TR0|DEMI MOORE, FOUNDER, DNA FOUNDATION:  I 
20101226035246.000|20101226035248.000|TR0|admire our next hero because of the brave 
20101226035248.000|20101226035250.000|TR0|and serious work she does.  Every day, 
20101226035250.000|20101226035252.000|TR0|this woman confronts the worst of what 
20101226035252.000|20101226035254.000|TR0|humanity has to offer.  She says stop; 
20101226035254.000|20101226035255.000|TR0|stop selling our girls.
20101226035255.000|20101226035257.000|TR0|
20101226035257.000|20101226035259.000|TR0|By raiding brothels and patrolling the 
20101226035259.000|20101226035301.000|TR0|India/Nepal border, she saves girls from 
20101226035301.000|20101226035302.000|TR0|being sold into the sex trade, where they 
20101226035302.000|20101226035304.000|TR0|are repeatedly raped for profit, tortured 
20101226035304.000|20101226035306.000|TR0|and enslaved.  Since 1993, she has helped 
20101226035306.000|20101226035308.000|TR0|rescue more than 12,000 women and girls.
20101226035308.000|20101226035310.000|TR0|
20101226035310.000|20101226035311.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226035311.000|20101226035313.000|TR0|

20101226035315.000|20101226035317.000|TR0|Nepal, she has provided not only a shelter 
20101226035317.000|20101226035319.000|TR0|for these girls and young women, but she 
20101226035319.000|20101226035320.000|TR0|has created a home, a place for them to 
20101226035320.000|20101226035322.000|TR0|heal, to go to school, learn a skill and, 
20101226035322.000|20101226035324.000|TR0|for some who are infected with HIV/AIDS, a 
20101226035324.000|20101226035326.000|TR0|place to spend their days where they're 
20101226035326.000|20101226035327.000|TR0|surrounded by love.

20101226035405.000|20101226035407.000|TR0|ANURADHA KOIRALA, CNN HERO:  She went to

20101226035410.000|20101226035412.000|TR0|also.  She was taken to India.  So she 
20101226035412.000|20101226035414.000|TR0|doesn't -- she cannot say anything.

20101226035416.000|20101226035418.000|TR0|We have seen children who have come back 
20101226035418.000|20101226035419.000|TR0|with, you know, broken legs, with HIV 
20101226035419.000|20101226035421.000|TR0|positive when they're 14, 13, which is 
20101226035421.000|20101226035423.000|TR0|very sad.  They're still child, you see?
20101226035423.000|20101226035425.000|TR0|
20101226035425.000|20101226035426.000|TR0|Maiti Nepal becomes a safe haven for them. 
20101226035426.000|20101226035428.000|TR0| It becomes a home, their own place where 
20101226035428.000|20101226035430.000|TR0|they can now stay, work, be happy and 
20101226035430.000|20101226035432.000|TR0|enjoy the rest of their life.  They call 
20101226035432.000|20101226035434.000|TR0|me Dijout (ph).  That means the elder 
20101226035434.000|20101226035435.000|TR0|sister.  So they have belief in me.  I'm 
20101226035435.000|20101226035437.000|TR0|really proud of that, that the children 
20101226035437.000|20101226035439.000|TR0|really believe in me.
20101226035439.000|20101226035441.000|TR0|
20101226035441.000|20101226035443.000|TR0|We are doing various programs in the 
20101226035443.000|20101226035444.000|TR0|villages.  We go from door to door 
20101226035444.000|20101226035446.000|TR0|campaigning.
20101226035446.000|20101226035448.000|TR0|
20101226035448.000|20101226035450.000|TR0|When the trafficker comes, he never says, 
20101226035450.000|20101226035451.000|TR0|I'm going to take your child and make her 
20101226035451.000|20101226035453.000|TR0|a prostitute.  He comes and says, there is 
20101226035453.000|20101226035455.000|TR0|a big job in the city.
20101226035455.000|20101226035457.000|TR0|
20101226035457.000|20101226035459.000|TR0|We have message for everyone.  So we are 
20101226035459.000|20101226035500.000|TR0|trying to educate all of them and saying 
20101226035500.000|20101226035502.000|TR0|that trafficking is inhuman.
20101226035502.000|20101226035504.000|TR0|
20101226035504.000|20101226035506.000|TR0|Just imagine what would happen if your 
20101226035506.000|20101226035508.000|TR0|daughter was standing there and if your 
20101226035508.000|20101226035509.000|TR0|daughter was there, what would you do?  
20101226035509.000|20101226035511.000|TR0|How would you fight? So you have to join 
20101226035511.000|20101226035513.000|TR0|hands.  You have to take each child as 
20101226035513.000|20101226035515.000|TR0|your daughter.
20101226035515.000|20101226035516.000|TR0|

20101226035533.000|20101226035534.000|TR0|
20101226035534.000|20101226035536.000|TR0|MOORE:  Ladies and gentlemen, it is my 
20101226035536.000|20101226035538.000|TR0|honor to present CNN Hero Anuradha Koirala.
20101226035538.000|20101226035540.000|TR0|
20101226035540.000|20101226035542.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20101226035542.000|20101226035543.000|TR0|
20101226035543.000|20101226035545.000|TR0|KOIRALA:  Namaste.  Today, I want to 
20101226035545.000|20101226035547.000|TR0|remember all my girls and survivors of 
20101226035547.000|20101226035549.000|TR0|trafficking back at Maiti Nepal.  I want 
20101226035549.000|20101226035550.000|TR0|to thank Bishua (ph), Bridget and Joe, 
20101226035550.000|20101226035552.000|TR0|Nesa (ph).  Please close your eyes and 
20101226035552.000|20101226035554.000|TR0|take every child as your own daughter.  
20101226035554.000|20101226035556.000|TR0|Soon you will feel their sorrow. And then 
20101226035556.000|20101226035558.000|TR0|you will feel the strength that comes out 
20101226035558.000|20101226035559.000|TR0|of you to protect them.
20101226035559.000|20101226035601.000|TR0|
20101226035601.000|20101226035603.000|TR0|Human trafficking is a crime, heinous 
20101226035603.000|20101226035605.000|TR0|crime, a shame to humanity.  I ask 
20101226035605.000|20101226035607.000|TR0|everyone to join me to create a society 
20101226035607.000|20101226035608.000|TR0|free of trafficking.  We need to do this
